dimensions:
image: 19.6 x 10.7 cm
plate: 22.9 x 13.5 cm
sheet: 29.4 x 20.3 cm
creditline: The Clarence H. White Collection, assembled and organized by Professor Clarence H. White Jr., and given in memory of Lewis F. White, Dr. Maynard P. White Sr., and Clarence H. White Jr., the sons of Clarence H. White Sr. and Jane Felix White

texts.textentryhtml:
Created by Robert Demachy, the artist. Acquired by Clarence H. White Sr., between ca. 1890 and July 7, 1925; by descent to Clarence H. White Jr., on or after July 8, 1925 [1]; by descent to Clarence H. White Jr.’s widow, Ruth Royer White, 1978 [2]; bequest, to Princeton University Art Museum, 1983 [3].

Notes:

[1]. Possibly on the occasion of Clarence H. White Sr.’s death, as part of the Clarence H. White Collection.
[2]. On the occasion of Clarence H. White Jr.’s death.
[3]. Carried out by Ruth Royer White on behalf of Clarence H. White Jr.
texts.remarks: as per research by Grace Xiao & Cecilia Moore - Summer 2024

caption: Robert Demachy (French, 1859–1936), Girl Reading. Photograph. The Clarence H. White Collection, assembled and organized by Professor Clarence H. White Jr., and given in memory of Lewis F. White, Dr. Maynard P. White Sr., and Clarence H. White Jr., the sons of Clarence H. White Sr. and Jane Felix White (x1983-1623)
